meanings.definition: The position or period of being a pupil or student, especially in a professional field.
meanings.sent1: During his pupillage, he learned a lot from experienced lawyers.
meanings.sent2: She completed her pupillage at a prestigious law firm.
meanings.sent3: The pupillage experience was like a crash course in legal practice.
meanings.sent4: In the world of law, pupillage is the stepping stone to becoming a lawyer.
meanings.sent5: The pupillage program provided hands-on training for aspiring attorneys.

meanings.definition: The state of being a pupil or apprentice.
meanings.sent1: His pupillage under the master craftsman was a valuable learning opportunity.
meanings.sent2: The pupillage period was crucial for developing his skills.
meanings.sent3: The pupillage felt like a journey into the world of craftsmanship.
meanings.sent4: In the workshop, pupillage was the path to mastery.
meanings.sent5: The young artist's pupillage led to remarkable improvements in his work.
